arts.ttl: Real Madrid 3-2 Alaves: Los Blancos survive late scare to seal win
arts.sum: The Brazilian picked the ball up deep and charged at his defender, and just as it looked as if he had narrowed the angle too much, Rodrygo fizzed a delightful strike across goal and beyond Antonio Sivera. Carlo Ancelotti's side roared to a comfortable 3-0 lead and looked set to play out the simplest of victories, only for two late Alaves goals to leave them sweating as they battled through to victory.

arts.ttl: “It’s a clear red card” – Alaves manager Luis Garcia Plaza furious with decision during Real Madrid defeat
arts.sum: Real Madrid edged their way to a fifth successive victory on Tuesday, as they saw off a brave fightback from Alaves at the Santiago Bernabeu. The visitors scored twice late on to make things interesting, and it could have been even more nervy had Endrick Felipe been shown a red card just before the goals. arts.ttl: Real Madrid 3-2 Alaves: Highlights, man of the match, stats
arts.sum: Real Madrid avoided an embarrassing late collapse to narrowly beat Alaves 3-2 as they conceded twice in a minute to make for a nervy end at the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu

arts.ttl: Mbappé extends scoring streak as Real Madrid beats Alaves 3-2 in Spanish league
arts.sum: Lucas Vázquez and Rodrygo also scored for Madrid, which extended its unbeaten run in the league to 39 matches — with 29 wins and 10 draws going back to last season. Mbappé's seventh goal since joining Madrid was a beauty, with the France forward starting a give-and-go with Jude Bellingham with a heal flick and then picking up the pass inside the area and using a nifty move to clear a defender before finding the net in the 40th minute at the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium.

arts.ttl: WATCH: Rodrygo Goes adds Real Madrid’s third goal against Alaves
arts.sum: Real Madrid have been prolific against Alaves in their MD7 clash at the Santiago Bernabeu. Carlo Ancelotti’s side have had big shots on target, and all three have resulted in goals being scored. arts.ttl: WATCH: Real Madrid double advantage against Alaves courtesy of Kylian Mbappe
arts.sum: Real Madrid made a dream start to their MD7 clash against Alaves after taking the lead inside the opening minute, and they have now built on that by adding a second goal at the Santiago Bernabeu. arts.ttl: Real Madrid vs Deportivo Alaves: Preview, predictions and lineups
arts.sum: Real Madrid are in midweek La Liga action as they welcome early-season surprise package Deportivo Alaves to the Bernabeu on Tuesday night. Alaves are aiming to snap Madrid's lengthy La Liga unbeaten run which was extended to 38 games at the weekend with a hard-fought 4-1 victory over Espanyol .

arts.ttl: Real Madrid predicted lineup vs Alaves
arts.sum: A 4-1 victory over Espanyol saw Real Madrid extend their unbeaten run in La Liga to a record-breaking 38 games on Saturday, but very little has been simple for Carlo Ancelotti's team at the start of the new season. RB: Lucas Vazquez - An injury sustained by goalscorer Dani Carvajal at the weekend means he likely won't feature on Tuesday and Vazquez, who was poor on his previous start against Stuttgart, should come into the team.
